com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<ContextClass extends android.content.Context>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<ContextClass>
  • Type Parameters:
    ContextClass - the class will holds the Context responsible for the command
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SmartCommands.GuardedHandler, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SmartCommands.AbstractSimpleGuardedCommand, SmartCommands.ProgressGuardedCommand
    Enclosing class:
    SmartCommands

    public abstract static class SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<ContextClass extends android.content.Context>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, SmartCommands.GuardedHandler
    A Runnable used as command, which is allowed to throw an exception during its execution.

    During the command execution, any thrown Throwable will be delivered to the exception handler through its ActivityController#handleException(Context, Throwable) method, so that it can be controlled in a central way, and not "swallowed".

    It has been specifically designed for being able to run Runnable which throw exceptions within the SmartCommands.SmartThreadPoolExecutor.

    Since:
    2010.06.08

      • SmartCommands.GuardedCommand

        public SmartCommands.GuardedCommand(ContextClass context,
                            java.lang.Object component,
                            SmartCommands.GuardedHandler delegate)
        Creates a command that may be executed through the SmartCommands.execute(SmartCommands.GuardedCommand) method, and which is able to tune any thrown exception during its execution.

        It is also possible to set the delegate as long as the command execution has not been started through the #setDelegate(GuardedHandler) method.

        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the execution originates, and which will be used when reporting a potential exception ; it is not allowed to be
        component - the component from which the execution originates, and which will be used when reporting a potential exception ; may be @{code null}
        delegate - if not null, the onThrowable(Throwable) execution will be delegated to it
        See Also:
        setDelegate(SmartCommands.GuardedHandler)

    • Method Detail

      • getContext

        protected final ContextClass getContext()
        Returns:
        the context which will be used for reporting a potential exception

      • getDelegate

        protected final SmartCommands.GuardedHandler getDelegate()
        Returns:
        the delegate to which the onThrowable(Throwable) method implementation will be redirected to ; may be null

      • setDelegate

        public SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<ContextClass> setDelegate(SmartCommands.GuardedHandler delegate)
        Sets the delegate that will be used in case of exception thrown during the command execution.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the exception handler which will be invoked when an exception is thrown during the command execution, via the onThrowable(Throwable) method; if null, no delegating mecanism will be involved
        Returns:
        the current instance, so as to ease its usage

      • runGuarded

        protected abstract void runGuarded()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        The body of the command execution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the method allows an exception to be thrown, and will be appropriately caught by the ActivityController#handleException(Activity, Throwable) method

      • onThrowable

        public java.lang.Throwable onThrowable(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        A fallback method which will be triggered if a Throwable is thrown during the runGuarded() method, so as to let the caller a chance to handle locally the exception.

        By default, the method does nothing and returns the provided throwable.

        Specified by:
        onThrowable in interface SmartCommands.GuardedHandler
        Parameters:
        throwable - the exception that has been thrown during the runGuarded() execution
        Returns:
        null if and only if the method has handled the exception and that the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler should not be invoked ; otherwise, the Throwable that should be submitted to the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler

      • run

        public final void run()
        This method will invoke the runGuarded() method, and handle any thrown exception.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
